questions.question: What is the resolution in Lincoln-Douglas Debate?

choices.answer: the topic that will be debated by two sides
making up one mind to do somethingmaking up one mind to do something
the clarity of a tv or computer monitor

questions.question: LD Debate is based on values, the ideals and principles held by a society or person.

choices.answer: the terms debated at the beginning of each round
standards, rules, tests, or measurements that judge the worth of your value
the definitions of the words in the resolution
the time limits of each round

questions.question: The first affirmative rebuttal rebuilds the affirmative case and attacks the negative case.
In LD Debate, you must research both sides of the topic.
What are some factors to consider in determining the credibility of a source?

choices.answer: whether the information is fact or opinion

questions.question: Research does not need to be organized.
What should be accomplished in the first affirmative constructive speech?

choices.answer: Show how your opponent is wrong.
why the issue is significant and present all the major arguments in case
Show why the resolution should be changed.

questions.question: Cross-examination periods are used to make rebuttal speeches.
The negative constructive rebuttal speech should

choices.answer: Present the negative's stand on the resolution only.
Attack the validity of the resolution.
Present the negative's stand regarding the resolution and attack the affirm
Pose questions for the affirmative to answer in the next round.

questions.question: The purpose of the second affirmative rebuttal speech is to

choices.answer: make a final impression on the judge
address any dropped point from earlier in the debate

questions.question: The purpose of the negative's final 6-minute rebuttal speech is to

choices.answer: Respond to the attacks on its case and emphasize the strengths of the negat
Convince the judge that the negative side is the strongest.
Repeat the weaknesses of the affirmative.

questions.question: How is Public Forum Debate different from LD Debate?

choices.answer: It's a two-on-two team debate, whereas LD is a one-on-one debate.
LD focuses on the value of the resolution, PF focuses on position of res
All of the above.All of the above.

questions.question: In crossfire, speakers from both teams may ask and answer questions.
Summary speeches and rebuttal speeches are EXACTLY the same.
It is acceptable to over-talk your opponent in crossfire.
In PF, the speech that provides the debater one last chance to tell the judge why his or team won the debate is called t
Mistakes are often a direct result of poor communication.
